com.novell.ldapchai.provider
Class JLDAPProviderImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.provider.JLDAPProviderImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChaiProvider, ChaiProviderImplementor
public class JLDAPProviderImpl
extends Object
implements ChaiProviderImplementor

JLDAP ChaiProvider implementation. This class wraps the JLDAP api at OpenLDAP.

Instances can be obtained using ChaiProviderFactory.

The current implementation does not support fail-over. If multiple LDAP urls are specified in the configuration, only the first one is used.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

init

public void init(ChaiConfiguration chaiConfig)
          throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                 IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: ChaiProviderImplementor
Initialize a newly created ChaiProvider instance. The init method can be called once and only once during the life of a provider. Calling any other method before init must result in an IllegalStateException, and calling the init method after it has already been called will also result in an IllegalStateException.

Specified by:
init in interface ChaiProviderImplementor
Parameters:
chaiConfig - A configuration object to be used by the instance
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - if the instance has already been initialized.

public void close()
Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Close the connection to ldap. All other operational methods (those that are marked with com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiProviderImplementor.LdapOperation) should throw an exception if called after this method.

Specified by:
close in interface ChaiProvider

Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Compares the value of a string to an ldap entry's specified attribute. Implementers of this method will actually perform an COMPARE operation, as opposed to doing a java .equals() style compare.

Parameters:

attribute - The attribute of the object DN to do the comparison to.
value - The value to compare against the value in the directory
Returns:

ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state

search

public Map<String,Map<String,String>> search(String baseDN,
                                             SearchHelper searchHelper)
                                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                                             ChaiUnavailableException,
                                             IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Performs a search against the directory for the objects, given the specified basedn and SearchHelper. A subtree search is implied. Attribute values are returned according to the attributes specifed in the SearchHelper.

Specified by:
search in interface ChaiProvider
Parameters:
baseDN - A valid object DN for the top of the search, or an empty string if the whole ldap namespace is to be searched
searchHelper - A Chai searchHelper
Returns:
A Map containing strings of entryDNs as keys, and values of Properties objects. Within each properties object the key is a specified attribute name and its associated value.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

search

public Map<String,Map<String,String>> search(String baseDN,
                                             String filter,
                                             Set<String> attributes,
                                             ChaiProvider.SEARCH_SCOPE searchScope)
                                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                                             ChaiUnavailableException,
                                             IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Performs a search against the directory for the objects, given the specified baseDN and filter. Additionally, the specified attributes are returned for any matches. Only the a single value of each attribute is returned.

Specified by:
search in interface ChaiProvider
Parameters:
baseDN - A valid object DN for the top of the search, or an empty string if the whole ldap namespace is to be searched
filter - A valid ldap search filter
attributes - An array containing the desired attributes to be returned. Set to null for all attributes, set to an empty String[] for no attributes
searchScope - Scope of the search
Returns:
A Map containing strings of entryDNs as keys, and values of Map objects. Within each map object the key is a specified attribute name and its associated value.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

searchMultiValues

public Map<String,Map<String,List<String>>> searchMultiValues(String baseDN,
                                                              SearchHelper searchHelper)
                                                       throws ChaiOperationException,
                                                              ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                              IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Perform a search where multiple values of an object are returned. Care should be taken to avoid very large search results, as the entire result set is held in memory before being returned to the caller.

Specified by:
searchMultiValues in interface ChaiProvider
Parameters:
baseDN - A valid entryDN
searchHelper - A Chai searchHelper
Returns:
A map containing Strings of DNs for keys, and a Map for values. The value map itself contains attribute name Strings as keys, and a List of values for each attribute.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

attributes - attribugtes to return. Null indicates all values, An empty array will return no values.

Returns:

getConnectionObject

public Object getConnectionObject()
                           throws Exception
Description copied from interface: ChaiProviderImplementor
Return the underlying connection object. The implementating class must decide which type of object to return, if any.

Extreme care must be taken when using this menu. The chai provider implementation typically does things with the underyling connection that your code will not expect, as well as the reverse. For example, Chai may invalidate the connection object in cases of load balancing or fail over.

For this reason, use of this method is strongly discouraged.

Specified by:
getConnectionObject in interface ChaiProviderImplementor
Returns:
a connection-level object used by the ChaiProvider implementation.
Throws:
Exception - any type of error at all, generated by the implementation

getDirectoryVendor

public ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR getDirectoryVendor()
                                                 throws ChaiUnavailableException
Description copied from interface: ChaiProvider
Discovers and returns the Chai API's interpretation of the vendor of the configured directory. ChaiProvider implementations will typically cache this value for the life of the instance.

Specified by:
getDirectoryVendor in interface ChaiProvider
Returns:
The Chai API's interpretation of the vendor of the configured directory.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
See Also:
ChaiUtility.determineDirectoryVendor(com.novell.ldapchai.ChaiEntry), ChaiSetting.DEFAULT_VENDOR
